DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Operable Presumed Malignant Glioma Intent Gross Total Resection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator whether or not patient has presumed high grade glioma that is intended for total surgical resection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Operable Presumed Malignant Glioma Intent Gross Total Resection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Describes a condition that can be treated by surgery._Likely to be true; accepted as true._A malignant neuroglial neoplasm. The term can apply to several primary neoplasm of the brain and spinal cord, including astrocytoma and oligodendroglioma in addition to others._An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action._Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Operable Presumed Malignant Glioma Intent Gross Total Resection
Property.preferredDefinition: Describes a condition that can be treated by surgery.:Likely to be true; accepted as true.:A malignant neuroglial neoplasm. The term can apply to several primary neoplasm of the brain and spinal cord, including astrocytoma and oligodendroglioma in addition to others.:An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.:Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

Concepts.definition: Describes a condition that can be treated by surgery.
Likely to be true; accepted as true.

A grade 3 or grade 4 glioma arising from the central nervous system. This category includes glioblastoma, anaplastic astrocytoma, anaplastic ependymoma, anaplastic oligodendroglioma, and anaplastic oligoastrocytoma.
An anticipated outcome that is the purpose for actions taken, thus guiding the action.
Surgical removal of an entire visible lesion, with no obvious lesion detected on post-operative evaluation; microscopic residual disease may be present.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have an oper
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an operable brain tumor presumed to be high grade glioma (HGG) based on clinical and radiological evaluation, where a gross total surgical resection of contrast-enhancing area is intended?

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for 1403 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 8/14/15
